images.copyright: The Hollywood sign overlooking Los Angeles, California (© Sean Pavone/Shutterstock)
images.title: Hollywood's big night
images.caption: Hollywood's big night
images.desc: It's Oscars night in Tinseltown, USA, and we're offering you a moment's escape from the paparazzi to gaze over the glittering megalopolis of Los Angeles, California—and to get an unfamiliar view of a familiar landmark. The Hollywood Sign originally read 'Hollywoodland' when it was erected in 1923 and festooned with light bulbs to advertise a real estate development. But within a few years, as the silent-film era gave way to 'talkies,' the sign evolved into a popular tourist attraction. Falling into disrepair in ensuing decades—at the peak of its decay, the sign was missing its third 'O' altogether—the original was demolished and a sturdier version built in 1978.

tooltips.walls: இந்த படத்தை பதிவிறக்கவும். வால்பேப்பருக்கு மட்டுமே பயன்படுத்த இந்தப் படம் கட்டுப்படுத்தப்பட்டுள்ளது.
